sn12.65:4.2: “Mendicants, before my awakening—when I was unawakened but intent on awakening—I thought:
sn12.65:4.3: ‘Alas, this world has fallen into trouble. It’s born, grows old, dies, passes away, and is reborn,
sn12.65:4.4: yet it doesn’t understand how to escape from this suffering, from old age and death.
sn12.65:4.5: Oh, when will an escape be found from this suffering, from old age and death?’
sn12.65:4.7: ‘When what exists is there old age and death? What is a condition for old age and death?’
sn12.65:4.8: Then, through rational focus, I comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.65:4.9: ‘When birth exists there’s old age and death. Birth is a condition for old age and death.’
sn12.65:5.10: What is a conditionm for name and form?’
sn12.65:5.11: Then, through rational focus, I comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.65:5.12: ‘When consciousness exists there’s name and form. Consciousness is a condition for name and form.’
sn12.65:5.14: ‘When what exists is there consciousness? What is a condition for consciousness?’
sn12.65:5.15: Then, through rational focus, I comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.65:5.16: ‘When name and form exist there’s consciousness. Name and form are a condition for consciousness.’
sn12.65:6.2: This consciousness turns back. It doesn’t go beyond name and form.
sn12.65:6.3: It is to this extent that one may be reborn, grow old, die, pass away, or reappear. That is: name and form is a condition for consciousness.
sn12.65:6.4: Consciousness is a condition for name and form.
sn12.65:6.5: Name and form is a condition for the six sense fields.
sn12.65:6.6: The six sense fields are conditions for contact. …
sn12.65:6.7: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.65:6.8: ‘Origination, origination.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.
sn12.65:7.2: ‘When what exists is there no old age and death?
sn12.65:7.3: When what ceases do old age and death cease?’
sn12.65:7.4: Then, through rational focus, I comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.65:7.5: ‘When rebirth doesn’t exist there is no old age and death.
sn12.65:7.6: When rebirth ceases old age and death cease.’
sn12.65:7.8: ‘When what doesn’t exist is there no birth …
sn12.65:7.16: When what ceases does name and form cease?’
sn12.65:7.17: Then, through rational focus, I comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.65:7.18: ‘When consciousness doesn’t exist name and form doesn’t come to be.
sn12.65:7.19: When consciousness ceases name and form ceases.’
sn12.65:8.2: ‘When what doesn’t exist is there no consciousness?
sn12.65:8.3: When what ceases does consciousness ceases?’
sn12.65:8.4: Then, through rational focus, I comprehended with wisdom:
sn12.65:8.5: ‘When name and form doesn’t exist, there is no consciousness.
sn12.65:8.6: When name and form cease, consciousness ceases.’
sn12.65:9.2: I have discovered the path to awakening. That is:
sn12.65:9.3: When name and form cease, consciousness ceases.
sn12.65:9.4: When consciousness ceases, name and form cease.
sn12.65:9.5: When name and form cease, the six sense fields cease.
sn12.65:9.6: When the six sense fields cease, contact ceases. …
sn12.65:9.7: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.
sn12.65:9.8: ‘Cessation, cessation.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in me regarding teachings not learned before from another.
sn12.65:10.1: Suppose a person was walking through a forest. They’d see an ancient path, an ancient road travelled by humans in the past.
sn12.65:10.3: they’d see an ancient city, an ancient capital, inhabited by humans in the past. It was lovely, complete with parks, groves, lotus ponds, and ramparts.
sn12.65:10.4: Then that person would inform a king or their minister:
sn12.65:10.5: ‘Please sir, you should know this. While walking through a forest I saw an ancient path, an ancient road travelled by humans in the past.
sn12.65:10.6: Following it along I saw an ancient city, an ancient capital, inhabited by humans in the past. It was lovely, complete with parks, groves, lotus ponds, and ramparts.
sn12.65:10.7: Sir, you should rebuild that city!’
sn12.65:10.8: Then that king or their minister would have that city rebuilt.
sn12.65:10.9: And after some time that city was successful and prosperous and full of people, attained to growth and expansion.
sn12.65:10.10: In the same way, I saw an ancient path, an ancient road travelled by fully awakened Buddhas in the past.
sn12.65:11.1: And what is that ancient path, the ancient road travelled by fully awakened Buddhas in the past?
sn12.65:11.2: It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
sn12.65:11.3: right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right samādhi.
sn12.65:11.5: This is that ancient path, the ancient road travelled by fully awakened Buddhas in the past.
sn12.65:11.6: Following it along, I directly knew old age and death,
sn12.65:11.9: and the practice that leads to their cessation.
sn12.65:11.11: Following it along, I directly knew rebirth …
sn12.65:11.21: Following it along, I directly knew choices,
sn12.65:11.24: and the practice that leads to their cessation.
sn12.65:11.25: Having directly known this, I told the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen.
sn12.65:11.26: And now this spiritual life has become successful and prosperous, extensive, popular, widespread, and well proclaimed among gods and humans.”
